title: Fixes for autograd bugs
body_html:
• torch.max(var, 0) did a max over the last dimension instead of the first (reported by Alex Conneau)
  • var.expand now accepts torch.Size as argument (#249)
  • Implemented in-place operators for variables
  • Fixed bug when the Variable constructor wasn't setting the error flags properly.
  • Return accreal as correct python type (previously it was always float). (#251)
  • Modified the signature of .max(), .median() and other selection functions to always return a tuple of values and indices. This is a breaking change.
body_text:
torch.max(var, 0) did a max over the last dimension instead of the first (reported by Alex Conneau)
var.expand now accepts torch.Size as argument (#249)
Implemented in-place operators for variables
Fixed bug when the Variable constructor wasn't setting the error flags properly.
Return accreal as correct python type (previously it was always float). (#251)
Modified the signature of .max(), .median() and other selection functions to always return a tuple of values and indices. This is a breaking change.
body:
* `torch.max(var, 0)` did a max over the last dimension instead of the first (reported by Alex Conneau)
* `var.expand` now accepts `torch.Size` as argument (#249)
* Implemented in-place operators for variables 
* Fixed bug when the Variable constructor wasn't setting the error flags properly.
* Return accreal as correct python type (previously it was always float). (#251)
* **Modified the signature of `.max()`, `.median()` and other selection functions to _always_ return a tuple of values and indices. This is a breaking change.**
